website_summaries.verdict: These quick-drying pads work well for both puppies and larger, older dogs.
pros: Super-absorbent core turns urine into gel instantly
Holds more than 3 cups of liquid
cons: Pads leaks underneath if your dog urinates near the edge

customer_reviews.title: These "were" great pads, but a change in the design has ...
customer_reviews.text: These "were" great pads, but a change in the design has made them flimsy and useless. We have a disabled dog and these were the perfect potty pads for him. A little more expensive then others but worth it because the quilted pad was thick and didn't rip or crumble when our dog stepped or moved around on them. However, the last two boxes I purchased had thinner flimsier pads. Clearly a change in the design since it was multiple boxes. Very disappointing as I am going through them twice as fast. Will be looking at different brands now.
customer_reviews.author: SoccerVixen

customer_reviews.title: Life Savers
customer_reviews.text: Never thought I would need puppy pads, as I don't have a dog. What I do have is a cat who stopped using the litter box. But, he does use the puppy pads faithfully. They consistently hold the urine with no leakage. They have provided a manageable solution to an unimaginable problem.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: USED TO BE GREAT.  NOW LEAKS.
customer_reviews.text: These use to be great. They were large, absorbent and didn't leak. That is no longer the case. I don't know if they are having problems with a batch or if they have cut corners because the product is now mediocre at best. The last 3 boxes I have bought I have noticed the padding were thinner than before and the plastic barrier now leaks. If a puppy pad leaks, I think that is a fundamental flaw in the design and it is no longer working for it's sole purpose. Too bad. Another great product that is now crap. I hope the corner cutting was worth losing everyone's business. I am now on the hunt for a something better.
customer_reviews.author: sterlingmoss

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the money, but...
customer_reviews.text: These pads are very good for your money. They are nice and thick and mask unwanted odors fairly well. As stated they’re 28” x 34” and come in a pack of 40. They are very absorbent and never leave any “leakage” persay, but there will always be some moisture that gets out (can’t blame the sellers though, nothing is 100% absorbent), so we ended up putting the pads insidewe bought just to make sure nothing gets on the floor. All-in-all a good product that we will continue to use.
customer_reviews.author: Top 10 Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried many different dog pads. I’ve tried the quilted, scented, carbon, name brand and off brand. These are the ones I’ll be coming back to. They are much thicker than anything I’ve bought before and don’t leak. UPDATE- last package was not the same. They weren’t as heavy or thick. Still the best on amazon, but I now am buying the chewy brand of dog pads.
customer_reviews.author: KLS

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as they were before
customer_reviews.text: We've been purchasing these pads for years. We tried others, but these performed great and suited our needs... until recently. They changed them somehow. Perhaps they removed a layer. They are not nearly as absorbent and the urine sits on the pad like a fresh puddle for hours. Since we have a few dogs, I must change the pads more frequently to prevent our dogs from stepping in the urine and tracking it around the house. This was not an issue with the prior pads. The urine soaked in quickly leaving the top layer dry enough for them to walk on. I'm very disappointed in this change and will begin searching for another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Rescue Dog Mom

customer_reviews.title: They leak 8-(
customer_reviews.text: I have an elderly girl who has become incontinent. After ruling out health issues, we decided to try these. They are barely better than nothing, heavy moisture leakage goes right through. We will try something else
customer_reviews.author: Doggonefool

customer_reviews.title: Has Changed
customer_reviews.text: After a long & expensive search for a training pad that truly did not leak, I landed on these. They started out great. They were large enough that I didn't have to lay down many. They were thick & did not leak through. I made many purchases however, my last 2 purchases I noticed they were not as thick anymore & I began having leak through. If they leak what's the point ? Guess I will be once again searching for the right training pad, I will not be purchasing these anymore!
customer_reviews.author: Wonderlust

customer_reviews.title: It was one time very good and it was not expensive
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this pad for my 5 LBS Maltese. It was one time very good and it was not expensive. However I am not happy with my last two purchase. I noticed the this pad is getting thinner and thinner, now it got so thin and does not hold the urine too much. I am now looking for different product. I see the reviews with five stars but for me, it was five stars maybe until last year but now it doesn't deserve get five stars any more.
customer_reviews.author: Willy

customer_reviews.title: Have Your Mop Ready!
customer_reviews.text: The urine soaked through the plastic. For how much they cost and how few are in the package and ultimately because of the urine leaking through the plastic, I had to keep replacing them and mopping the floor. It certainly wasn't helping keep the smell away of all that urine constantly getting on the floor, especially when I couldn't mop it immediately. I cancelled my subscription to them. There is one offered locally. I was really hoping that these would work better because they are so much bigger. They just aren't worth the much higher price when you add everything up, not just counting their initial price.
customer_reviews.author: JustDea

customer_reviews.title: Old dogs can learn new tricks.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use for my 15 years old, 85 pound dog. We keep her in the house now and she recently started have accidents in the house. Mainly at night. These pads have worked GREAT! They absorb her urine and do not seep through. I will be buying them again for as long as my old gal is with us.
customer_reviews.author: MARY

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: I compared prices & 100 pads for 20$ is a great deal. I was running low and my puppy doesn't get to go out while I'm at work for several hours unless my roommate is home so I use pee pads daily. And I change it daily. The quantity was worth the price. Not sure if dogs can sense the pad is meant to be peed, the box states it does. My dog was already pre trained before buying this item. The package arrives within 7 days.
customer_reviews.author: John Vault

customer_reviews.title: Love the size
customer_reviews.text: Love the size; however, I am very disappointed in the quality. I have a 9 lb dog and these pads do not hold the urine in. I pick it up and the underside and floor are soaking wet. Not sure why other reviews are so good. Really miss Nature’s Miracle Pee Pads. They were the best. I will not be purchasing these again and am surprised they are being sold by Amazon. The products they sell are usually very high quality.
customer_reviews.author: NOLAgal

customer_reviews.title: Horrible quality since packaging change. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using these for YEARS and loved them. That was until (as many other customers have mentioned) they changed the packaging and the quality of the pad itself has disappeared.. They now LEAK FROM THE BOTTOM. They used to be thick and absorbent, now they are thin and useless. With the leaking I’ll now be forced to find a new brand of pee pads. So disappointing that this company has allowed the quality to slip like this. Sadly I’m sure it will result in them losing all their loyal customers (like me) :(
customer_reviews.author: Alex Kirkwood

customer_reviews.title: They used to be good!!! 👎🏼
customer_reviews.text: They use to be good, we loved it, since our dog is staying home dog more than outside dog, he pee in his pad, and we were very happy with the product but the last box (we have a subscription) the pad are really thin, I don’t think they can even hold one pee, i’m very disappointing. Maybe i just stop the subscription and buy a different brand. They were our number 1 brand for 5 years!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra M.

customer_reviews.title: So so
customer_reviews.text: It does not absorb that much. Have to mop everytime replacing it.
customer_reviews.author: Pei

customer_reviews.title: Quality changed. Too thin and flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the new box of pads I received recently is terrible compared to the box I had purchased before this. Why did they change the quality? They are now too thin, they are scratchier and not as smooth and the white pad part is not centered as well as the ones in the previous box I purchased. I would not recommend these. I'd return these, but I don't live near a UPS. I will not be purchasing these again.
customer_reviews.author: TB

customer_reviews.title: Quality has gone down the toilet
customer_reviews.text: I have been using for over a year and the last box was substandard the urine puddles underneath the pad trying a different brand
customer_reviews.author: joan fraser

customer_reviews.title: Cant Imagine why the large size is worse than the small
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this brand in a small size for a yorkie everyday for 4 yrs... i get a new puppy Yo-chon so got the larger size so it can cover more ground... this is still a small breed less thant 5lbs puppy, this size is filmsy even to the touch compared to the smaller ones i own... im a horified as i bought the 200-pack. im basically using and wasting... as only one or 2 potty use and it is destroyed... no hold...no absorption... she tracks pee all over the pads... just puddling... wont buy this size again...maybe will just hunt for a new brand altogether.... bummer
customer_reviews.author: Alodami

customer_reviews.title: Leak city :(
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews, but believe anyone on here who says you get what you pay for. These are most definitely NOT leak-proof - after a few days of thinking my dog was just somehow missing the mark, I finally realized the urine was just leaking through the pads, not only causing puddles all over my floor, but forcing me to spend hours scrubbing/cleaning with expensive enzymatic cleaners, while my dog is STILL quite certain the floor is now an acceptable place to pee. It's been a daily nightmare. Seriously, find pads that are well-received and keep your floors dry! You'll thank me for it!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff L.

customer_reviews.title: Newly AWFUL Quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm an old lady with health problems and have been using these on bed and armchair for a year now. They were great, but NO MORE! Quality has gone WAY down in last 2 orders, so they've used up their 2nd chance. Now they're less absorbent, they rip easily (2x just shaking one open!) especially the plastic bottom (watch your nails!), the top layer doesn't stay attached, but worst of all they EFFIN' LEAK THRU!!! making them totally useless. Cancelling my subscription, of course. Ordered lots of other brands to test, any recommendations?
customer_reviews.author: Kayanne

customer_reviews.title: What happened
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying this brand of training pads for quite some time. The training pads from the last order were thinner than usual. When I open a pad there is some kind of white residue that falls out of the pads; I had to mop every time I picked up one of the used pads, which only held about 75% of my dogs urine (she's a Doxie - so it wasn't that much). The white residue also floated through the air landing on the furniture making me have to dust more often. I don't know what happened - but I won't be reordering these pads.
customer_reviews.author: Marla D

customer_reviews.title: Thank you
customer_reviews.text: Our old doggie had surgery including pain pills which sedated her and she could not control her bladder for the first time in over 10 years. These were not perfect but they worked very well. I just wish they had been just a tad bigger. But I am grateful that I found them. Therefore I would recommend them. Thank you fellow Amazon reviewers for your candid reviews which helped me so much in choosing a product!!
customer_reviews.author: U Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: BEST
customer_reviews.text: I'm not one to cut corners or go cheap, so I started off with higher end and pricier pads. But they were not odor absorbent, which was very important to me. I bought these on a whim because they had good reviews and also because we had to change our Frenchie pup's pad after every poo due to coccidia. I didn't have high hopes at these pad's performance. But they have been my FAVORITE. Effective, cheap, perfect size for our potty tray. 1000% recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: The BEST piddle pads!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best piddle pads I've found, and at a reasonable price. These are also among the largest you can find. The larger size helps them stay put better and makes it less likely to miss the pad. The smaller sized ones get crumpled too easily, making for more accidents on the floor. After using these larger sized ones, I refuse to go back to the smaller ones. These also absorb quickly. I left one of these out in the rain and found out it contains the same absorbent material that diapers contain, so the liquid gets encapsulated into a gel-like substance. It absorbed so much rain water that it bursted out of the pad.
customer_reviews.author: DelMar

customer_reviews.title: So Much Better than other Pads
customer_reviews.text: These are great potty pads!! SOO MUCH BETTER than the charcoaL ones!! We bought one bag of the charcoal potty pads months ago, our maltese/shitzu is potty trained but we always keep one down for emergency. So when you have a puppy sized dog 🐕 you don't go thru very many real fast. Now we get to the All Absorb Training Pads they absorb wonderfully& they are just the right size. We don't have to worry about the liquid rolling off the sides like we did the other type. These are so nice. Buy them, you will be so happy you did, they work so well & the price is Definately PERFECT!
customer_reviews.author: D.L. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Double up for safety!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe I've been buying these for a few years at least, and just noticed the past couple times, they LEAKED through to the carpet! Not cool so, I am going to double up which I should not have to but I don't want anything on my carpet either. Disappointed in pee pads 😟
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Stutz

customer_reviews.title: One Major  Caveat!
customer_reviews.text: These pads are excellent. They truly absorb any liquid and there isn't odor. Here's ONE major problem. For years, these pads arrived in a box that was easily stored and stacked, one on one. Now, the pads arrive in a very inconvenient, flimsy plastic. I always purchase several at one time and now, I can no longer stack them because they topple over. I sure wish the manufacturer would go back to packaging in a manner that helps their buyer. : )
customer_reviews.author: IRISH

customer_reviews.title: Dogs and elderly incontinence take notice!
customer_reviews.text: When owning dogs especially during puppy stage, there’s one thing that infinitely improves its owner’s quality of life. Haha These don’t leak as long as the dog goes on the white padding and not the outer perimeter plastic. These are made very well to soak up liquids. I have used this brand for quickly throwing over even just spills of something if I don’t have a paper towel nearby. I bought this larger size to help protect my grandmothers chair and bed from her recent developing incontinence. They have saved both from lots more cleanup. They don’t hold a whole bladder full, but they do really well if there’s a small puddle/dribbles.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Carrigg

customer_reviews.title: Not made in the USA. Made in China.
customer_reviews.text: Just received this item today. Not very happy. The item photo clearly shows made in the USA but actually made in China will not buy from this seller again. False advertising.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Heath

customer_reviews.title: What a shame!
customer_reviews.text: I have used these pads for years through many puppies and elderly dogs. Always dependable until the last couple of orders. These are much thinner and they LEAK! Now I have to double them up so a higher price that was justified for the quality is now not worth buying. I haven't found anything better yet, but I am looking and SO disappointed that they would change a good product!
customer_reviews.author: Copper

customer_reviews.title: Folded sides and absorbancy issues
customer_reviews.text: Last batch had all 4 sides folded down which (after 5 pks) have never had before. So I have to unfold all the blue banding on every single pad which is annoying and time consuming. Also these pads had chunky pieces in the pad - like the absorbent layer of material inside did not spread evenly throughout the pad as it should. Manufacturing issue. Will try another product next time.
customer_reviews.author: Nita

customer_reviews.title: Will NOT purchase again!!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the worst purchase of pee pads I ever made. They are extremely thin!! In fact, I’ve even thrown away some of the pads rather than putting them down for my 2 toy Shelties to use because they were practically “see-through”!! They DO NOT absorb pee as claimed, allowing my two to prance their little pee-paw prints all over my house!! I purchased these because of all the good reviews...guess I got duped...lesson learned!!! Will NOT purchase again!!
customer_reviews.author: C Bourgeois

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: We recently started kenneling our 14 year old Jack Russell Terrier, so we bought a small pet pad and purchased the 'All Absorb' training pads as well. Although they claim these would work with the small pet pad holder, they're a bit big for it. I was worried I would need to manually cut out pieces of the pads to get the handles on the holder to snap closed, but they snap closed as is, so no need to remove some of the 'over hang' of the pads. They're very absorbent and are convenient to use for clean up. Just roll them up and toss them in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: PRJS

customer_reviews.title: Maybe its just my 3 lazy mutts?
customer_reviews.text: Leaks when over 1 small potty spot in the center from the 8lb chiweenie but the 20lb mutts love the edges and those love the run UNDER the pads, defeating their purpose. My vinyl plank flooring is taking a beating and I am getting so mad, the potty wrap I bought is too small for my male fat old grumpy german so have to try another route (he is a 12.5yr old dachshund and just started this). Maybe I just need to put them outside when I go to work? They have a dog door to a covered screened porch and another dog door from there to a well groomed, grassy yard. Spoiled brats.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Halliday

customer_reviews.title: best pads for best price
customer_reviews.text: After trying many brands we have settled on these All-Absorb as our only dog potty pads. The ones by AKC were terrible! They (and others) didn't absorb anything. It was like a paper towel over thin plastic. One pee would spread out to cover nearly the whole pad and remain wet for tracking. These hold the liquid in one spot and it doesn't track. Also the plastic backing doesn't leak. The bottom of the clear plastic storage bucket that we use as a potty (cutting an opening in one short side) is always dry underneath. Makes having a small inside dog so much easier. We buy this 200 bulk pack for more savings.
customer_reviews.author: Kivak

customer_reviews.title: the best wee wee pad for my dog
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered a few different brands of wee wee pads over the years from Amazon and this one is the best. The technology and construct are similar in all brands of pads but this one does stand out from the rest for me. Here's what I like: - the urine gels quickly and doesn't spread as quickly as others that I've tried - the absorbent part of the pad doesn't separate from the plastic leak proof bottom - feels slightly thicker than some of the other brands I've tried which reassures me that this will hold up longer
customer_reviews.author: Sh0p4KiX

customer_reviews.title: Not all pads are leak proof
customer_reviews.text: Some pads leaked thru plastic backing, some did not. Not reliable, therefore cant recommend
customer_reviews.author: Robert Griswold

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pads for adult dogs
customer_reviews.text: I use these pads for adult dogs and I have used several different brands, in search of the largest, most absorbent pads for the value. These pads are by far the bet I have ever purchased and used. They are thicker and absorbent, with no leaking and also they are larger than most available. I will purchase again and hope that the manufacturer doesn't change the product. Definitely a good product and delivery was unbelievably quick. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda B.

customer_reviews.title: Great for cats too
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because my little, old man sometimes misses the litter box. One of these pads covers the front of both of my side-by-side litter boxes and prevents urine from getting on the floor and under the boxes and festering there. It also catches tracked litter and any little poops that don't make it into the box. Recently, the little guy took sick and had diarrhea and was incontinent for over a week. I lined the couch with these pads and nothing got through. They're really great! Kept the couch (his resting spot) clean until he was well enough to get back to the box to do his business.
customer_reviews.author: Anita

customer_reviews.title: Great pad, great price
customer_reviews.text: I switched to these pads after my previous brand increased in price so much that they weren't affordable anymore. They were (I thought) the best pad out there - much better than what I could find at our local Wal-Mart and other department stores. I was hoping these would be at least half as good (no leaking, reduced smell, etc.) as my previous brand. Well, they're just as good, and at half the price the other brand climbed to. So glad I found them, and appreciate the previous buyers sharing their good reviews that helped me decide to give them a try (after trying so many others that leaked and messed up my floors and carpet).
customer_reviews.author: RatherBeTraveling

customer_reviews.title: So they absorb a bit better. Nice quality
customer_reviews.text: I'd actually rate these at 4.5. These are much thicker than the "pee pads" I bought at the local pet store. A little larger too. So they absorb a bit better. Nice quality. But they are kind of expensive. I don't find any of the pee pads really good though as the pee sinks through the material and plastic and gets on the floor on all brands.. and I have a small dog! But compared to the pet store pads, these are as good as you will get if you don't mind spending the money.
customer_reviews.author: Coasternut

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a leak proof potty pad
customer_reviews.text: I picked up these extra large potty pad full of pee to find it completely dry underneath. Top Paw from Petsmart were saturated under the pad and would drip pee when trying to move it to the trash. Simple Solution from Amazon also leaked and was wet under the pad, but All-Absorb really stands up to it's name. They are by far the most absorbent potty pad I've used. The size is perfect for large dogs/puppies. Save yourself the frustration and money of trying other pads. These are the best pads on the market and priced much lower! Great value!!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Apodaca

customer_reviews.title: 66% of the time: Fails to contain pee of 12 pound puppy
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after initially just getting some pee pads from the grocery store. 2/3 of the time, my dog pees through this pad and when I pick it up it's literally dripping with urine. She's a 12 pound, 4 month old Boston Terrier puppy. I didn't think I would need to have something more substantial for such a small dog.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney A. Farrell, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: For the price, yes.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 5 month old 35lb puppy. I've been using these since he was 12 weeks old. It is a much better value item then what I would pick up in the pet store. I've tried the scented ones, the tough ones, etc, and they don't seem to matter. He's almost grown out of using them but I still put them by the door for accidents. I've got to say that I have always noticed a little pee seeps through so I wouldn't use these to guard a delicate carpet. However, I don't have enough experience to tell you about one that doesn't leak through a little bit as the others I've purchased have done the same.
customer_reviews.author: Middle aged woman

customer_reviews.title: These work great for senior kitty peeing outside his litterbox
customer_reviews.text: These work great for us. Our senior, chubby kitty decided he didn't like his litterbox after using it for more than 10 years. We tried everything, had him checked etc. Our floors were being destroyed by using newspapers alone, until we got these. He has no problem peeing on them. The pee turns gel-like and stays put. We tuck it under the bottom of the litterbox edge to keep it in place, with newspapers underneath. Very rarely has any pee gotten onto the newspaper, only a tiny bit if he went too far to the edge and missed it. So glad these came back in stock and hope they never stop selling them.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart & Bridget

customer_reviews.title: If you are elderly, be careful
customer_reviews.text: I am quite dedicated to this product. The pads are the best size, value, function for my three small dogs. However, I have had to cancel my subscription feature. I realize this will sound funny (even to me), but it was not funny. I am quite elderly and while emptying the very large box, I fell into it quite hard and at a funny angle. AND, then, I could not get out. I do have a device to call for help, but who wants to call the fire department to get you out of a box?!? Sadly, I cancelled my subscription, but will order the product individually.
customer_reviews.author: morningglory

customer_reviews.title: absorbent, easy clean up
customer_reviews.text: This product has been perfect for my needs. We have older ferrets that sometimes 'miss' the litter box. I put a pad down and the litter box on top and the clean up of any 'misses' is a breeze. I believe I had one leak once which wasn't too bad because I have hard floors which are easy to clean. I cannot speak for how leakproof they would be for a higher flow or volume of urine. I also cannot speak for how well they work for potty training. Again, for my needs, this product is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Chezz

customer_reviews.title: Not able to retain liquid
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 x 9 inch Yorkies. They go potty outside and in. The pads are a good size for our pad holder, but they are not able to retain liquid. Only works if we are ready to switch the pads immediately or.double or triple pad it. 》》 Please have your folks rework the absorbency. The cost and size won me over, but I have to move on due to the hardwood floors. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Grateful Family

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Pads!
customer_reviews.text: These pads work very well! I do not recommend letting it get soaked all the way through. It's good for about two or three uses. My Pomeranians don't like using pads that look dirty. Lol. They are very clean little creatures. The pads are great for everyday use, or for those days when you don't want to take them out, because of inclement weather. It's also handy for when they wake up in the middle of the night, and they want to go.
customer_reviews.author: LindaTop Contributor: Crochet

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Reptile substrate
customer_reviews.text: I trained my bearded dragon! She only potties outside her terrarium now :) and beardie waste is super watery & the poop really stinky but the pads absorb both well- no leak for reptiles 🤗🥳 also my reptile’s nails don’t get stuck on the pads it enables her to move quickly and comfortably. The fact they absorb moisture helps reduce chances of fungus or stink building in terrarium. I cut up the pads and change the pieces every two weeks to reduce amount of bacteria in tank too
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Great product, and value
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I use these for floor liners in front of a cat litter box where accidents happen. 17 year old kitty goes in the box, but pee pees outwards onto the pad. the pads soak up everything she does, and I have to change them every 2 or 3 days. No liquid has soaked to the floor. I do have a thin styrofoam liner underneath the pads just in case, but these work great and the value is much better than buying at the local pet supply store.
customer_reviews.author: K L

customer_reviews.title: Love the larger ones for aiming accuracy for my two small dogs. Great absorbency.
customer_reviews.text: Theses are great pads even for smaller dogs. There is more surface area for urination so as not to miss by accident. The holding power is amazing. There is never any spillage from the pups bathroom use (unless of course they tend to go on the edge where they are not meant to go). I put about three down, overlapping before heading to work so they are sure to hit them. If I stay away from home longer than an anticipated I k ow that any mess there may be is only a matter of rolling up one or two pads and everything is good to go.
customer_reviews.author: TheRustyApple

customer_reviews.title: THICKNESS
customer_reviews.text: WHILE I LOVE THE SIZE OF THESE PADS, AS THEY CAN BE USED SEVERAL TIMES, THEY ARE NOT AT ALL ABSORBENT. ONE OF MY DOGS PEES REALLY LARGE PEES, SO THEY LEAK RIGHT THROUGH TO THE PADS I PUT UNDERNEATH. THEY SPECIFY EXTRA ABSORBENT, SO I THOUGHT THEY WOULD DO THE TRICK. I END UP HAVING TO PUT 2 DOWN AT NIGHT.
customer_reviews.author: Carol ellwood

customer_reviews.title: The way of packing
customer_reviews.text: I really liked recent package coming with just delivery stamp on. No cardboard box! It is dog's pee pad, non breakable thing with thick plastic bag, so there is no need to put it into big cardboard box but usually came with that. But today finally there was no box, just put the address stamp on the bag.We care about earth, eco so I hate to have too many cardboard box. So I hope you or third party use the commonsense and hope keeping to do unnecessary packing! It was perfect today!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mina

customer_reviews.title: Been a life saver so far
customer_reviews.text: My dog is on lasix so these are laid out in a path to the exits and so far have saved my rugs numerous times. No leaks despite being laid down for various lengths of time and different states of wear. Some last 2 weeks + on the ground, higher traffic areas the outer layer wears off in a week. Still no leaks with the worn upper layer. Have them laid out under Max's bedding and so far lasts a week with 50 lb dog and claws. Will continue buying as long as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Zsombor Varsovczky

customer_reviews.title: Small dog? Buy these!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these pads, they're great for small dogs. My yorkie baby is 3 years old and has been using these since she was a month old .. never had any leakage issues and I change it daily. They are laid on linoleum would not recommend laying and brand directly on carpet.
customer_reviews.author: Danah

customer_reviews.title: I used these for months and really liked them. The last couple of boxes that were ...
customer_reviews.text: I used these for months and really liked them. The last couple of boxes that were delivered had a very strong chemical smell when I opened the box. Ordered the re-usable piddle pads and will never go back.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Absorbent But Could Use Sticky Tape on the Back
customer_reviews.text: Well, I bought two packs for my puppy starter kit. They are great, but my baby Beauceron peed on them one time and then decided they were better as chew toys. I gave up and used the old fashioned “Jump up when he circles!” technique instead. They are a good product—I donated them to my local animal shelter. Having sticky tape in the bottom would be a good addition. Still, I give this 5 stars because of the size, cost, and absorbency.
customer_reviews.author: Jill S.

customer_reviews.title: They work well!
customer_reviews.text: It is more important to me that the dog likes them. She does. She is very picky about everything and uses these pads without hesitation. I dropped a small full watering can for !y plants and ended with dry carpet. I was shocked.
customer_reviews.author: jane orpah coria

customer_reviews.title: Work fine.
customer_reviews.text: I decided to try these larger ones to see if they worked better for our dog. They do absorb fine, but in reality in our case they aren't worth the extra price compared to the smaller ones. When we ran out, we went back to the small ones. Oh, just in case you're wondering, or dog is a mini-dachshund. I would say that this brand, large or small, is the best brand we have found anywhere. I recommend them for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Jon McAvoy

customer_reviews.title: love these and buy them all the time for my dog!
customer_reviews.text: living in a big city where it rains and snows sometimes, it good to train your dog to pee on pads. these are pretty great! My dog is a maltese about 10-15lbs and pees a lot. He will pee and poop multiple times on one pad and i just pick up the pad and toss it out and replace it. it's great knowing my dog can go when he needs to if im at work or the weather is bad, and it's very absorbent, never has it bled through the pad on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda S.

customer_reviews.title: Less mess to clean after an exhausting workday.
customer_reviews.text: I have two small dogs that do not get to go outside while my partner and I are at work and these pee pads are a life saver. I no longer have to totally mop the floor every time I come home and only have a small manageable mess to clean up and then put a new pad down. Very very helpful especially if you have a dog with separation anxiety that will go everywhere when you leave.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Great quality.
customer_reviews.text: This product is very durable and sanitary. I was shocked to see the quality after only paying $5.77 for a pack of 40. I went to order more today just to have back up and the price was up to $20. I will go to Ocean State Job Lot when I need more as they’re only about $8 there. This is a great purchase, though, if convenience of online shopping is what’s best for you.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Regis

customer_reviews.title: Best puppy pads I have found
customer_reviews.text: These are by far the best training pads I have found. They are absorbent, and stay put better than any other I have tried. My puppy pees like a horse, and every other brand I had tried, she soaked through. These actually hold up, which saves me from constantly scrubbing floors. They also contain the smell better than others I have tried. I won't be trying any other brands in the future, because these are the most affordable as well.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Have used for years, LOVE these pads!!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE 10/4/19: I'm now ordering from Chewy.com, as these take too long to come! Same price, superior service! I LOVE these pads, they're the best I've found. Sometimes their a bit inconsistent in quality, with the padding seeming to be thinner than other times, but all-in-all I love them. Having an older Yorkie rescue who pees in the house a lot, these pads are a lifesaver. Well, I could cover the whole floor with them, as he sometimes goes on the carpet...but these are great!
customer_reviews.author: R. Burns

customer_reviews.title: Absorbent and can be multipurpose
customer_reviews.text: My older dog uses these during thunderstorms when she is afraid to pee outside or if we have a long day out of the home, which is rare. She does not have a problem returning going back outside when we stop using these. Very absorbent, leaves no wet spots on floor. We even use clean ones to dry the floor after mopping instead of waiting for it to dry
customer_reviews.author: My Ama

customer_reviews.title: Good quality pads, will continue buying.
customer_reviews.text: I have to keep pee pads stocked up for my dog, so I have been buying these once every couple months for awhile now. I have tried several different brands from different stores and these ones are the best for the price. They are not thin and flimsy like many of the others and the XL size means I don't have to use as many. They do not leak as long as the liquid doesn't hit the edge of the pad, so I usually layer a couple pads where I need them. Overall, I think these are a quality product and I will continue to buy them.
customer_reviews.author: m Mason

customer_reviews.title: Perfect puppy pads!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best puppy pads ever! I have a small dog but I buy the XLarge because of the absorption factor, and they don’t have to be changed as often. I will say I have a “mud room” on my house and that’s where I put the puppy pads. My dog goes through the doggy door out to her pads. And at that, there isn’t the normal “sometime” odor. They are just fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Lastborn

customer_reviews.title: Absorbs all pee with no leakage!
customer_reviews.text: We have an elderly Chihuahua who can't hold her bladder. No matter how often we were talking her out, she was still sneaking off and peeing all over our carpets. Did a ton of research, read a ton of reviews, and found this product. It is a game changer! We laid them out in all her favorite pee spots and they work great at absorbing all of her pee with zero leakage. We buy about one box every three weeks, which can get pricey, but it is worth it to have a clean home again.
customer_reviews.author: Monkeedo

customer_reviews.title: Good potty training pads
customer_reviews.text: These are the only training pads I’ve used since Ive had my puppy, so I don’t have anything else to compare it to. Fits perfectly in the pee pad tray of the same brand. Puppy uses them almost 90% of the time, so the attractant seems to work. I like the large amount (120) that comes in each bag. Some pads seem thinner than others, but hasn’t caused an issue with leakage. I usually dispose after 2 uses, but they have held up with 3 pees. I thrown them in the outside bin, because they will smell up the bathroom garbage can after a few days.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lower Quality Over the Months
customer_reviews.text: I buy these to use as wee wee pads for my dog. Last couple of shipments the pads were lower quality. Can now see the fold lines so don’t lay flat on the floor and I’ve slipped on them, less absorbing. Will stop my auto ship if next order is the same. I don’t know where to find the vendor. I will take photos in case I can figure out how to post.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: I have a french bulldog and he is indoor trained. I am able to use one pad and it holds quite a bit. I have ordered my fourth pack. I have not found anything comparable in pet stores. I also like the size as it does help cover the area I use most for him. I have no problems with the packaging nor any any problems, like tears in any of the pads. I will continue ordering these and from this vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Haney

customer_reviews.title: Not leak proof
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these because they have pretty good reviews. They are smaller than the standard squares. After trying them out with my Yorkie, they kept on leaking through to my floor. Whenever I picked them up after they were used one time, I would always find some kind of moisture underneath. I tried giving these the benefit of the doubt and used about half the bag, but every time I cleaned it up, it was the dog urine. I will not be re-purchasing this item. I bought a different brand and saw an immediate difference.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: X-Large pee pads
customer_reviews.text: These are by far the best absorbent pads. My large male cat can't outpee the pad capacity. I use these as liners in his litter box.
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: MADE IN CHINA awful quality
customer_reviews.text: NOW MADE IN CHINA. The quality has significantly decreased. They have an odd odor. They are less absorbent and they are not put together well. I couldn't figure out what was going on until I took another look at the package. DISGUSTING! I can't believe they are still advertising that these are made in USA.
customer_reviews.author: Jayne Doh

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome!
customer_reviews.text: These worked perfectly well for me. I love that they don’t leak through! Was kinda hesitant reading some of the reviews but decided to try them out. We just got our first puppy so potty training has been rough, but thankfully no leak throughs ! = less clean up ! This is now my second order and will definitely keep buying this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Xbox 360

customer_reviews.title: Happy Dog and Mom
customer_reviews.text: Before I got these I couldn’t interest my older dog into using a pee pad. I live on the fourth floor of a building with an elevator and sometimes it’s asking too much of him to wait until we make the trek outside. So I keep one of these available for him at all times even though he primarily uses it in the middle of the night. I like the quality as they don’t leak and I like the larger size.
customer_reviews.author: NMJacoby

customer_reviews.title: Easy clean up after #1 or #2 accidents!!
customer_reviews.text: Pads work great for our 11 year old Westie. She is potty trained but sometimes accidents will occur and she always hits the pads. They are infused with an attractant that works well for her. Our son has a one year old German shepherd and does her business on the pads also. These pads are a life saver especially if you’re dog has “runny“ stool! Just throw away pad and put a new one in it’s place!
customer_reviews.author: Ronald N.

customer_reviews.title: Works good for changing tables
customer_reviews.text: Super thin but works well for our baby changing table! I wouldn’t recommend for pets since it’s think and narrower than other wee pads. We use another brand for our Yorkies wee pads.
customer_reviews.author: Yvie B

customer_reviews.title: Product changed
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying these for the past 18 months. Recently, they changed from a cardboard box to a soft-plastic package. The product inside changed too. The underside blue is now slightly different material because it seems thinner and softer. I've been seeing some pee underneath the pad as well. I'm switching brands to see if something is better.
customer_reviews.author: Will S

customer_reviews.title: Good pads!
customer_reviews.text: These pads are very good!I took one star off because sometimes they leak.But it doesn’t happen very often.I have tried a few brands and these are the best I have found.
customer_reviews.author: K.Y.

customer_reviews.title: Misleading description
customer_reviews.text: Don't be fooled. These pads are described on Amazon and on the package itself as measuring 28 x 34 inches. That's only accurate if you count the plastic border. The pads themselves measure 23.5 inches by 29 inches.
customer_reviews.author: mw

customer_reviews.title: Great product, beats any from any store!
customer_reviews.text: I have used these for my dog for the last 8 years , from puppy to the present. She does relieve herself outdoors but on a rainy day this product is perfect. The size and absorbency is perfect .
customer_reviews.author: jimzee

customer_reviews.title: Best doggon training pads I have ever found!
customer_reviews.text: OMDog these are the best I have ever found. I took a leap of faith and bought 3 boxes hoping they would be at least as good as the ones I have been able to purchase over the last few years. These are far beyond anything I have been able to find. Far better absorbency, size is the best! I have gone from a spread of 6 to a spread of 4. (3 Chihuahuas) Some of the best money I have ever spent on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Fran

customer_reviews.title: lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: I never used these for my previous dogs. I'm so glad I bought them for my newest ankle biter who I've nicknamed the pooper. He's a few months old and doesn't care if he's inside or out when nature calls. But he usually uses a pad if he's inside. So, again, I'm very thankful I got these and hopefully he'll grow out of them.
customer_reviews.author: CTCraftBrew

customer_reviews.title: Works like they should
customer_reviews.text: My pup is 6 months old and is able to go outside most of the time, but with these super large pads she never makes a mess on my wood floor. If we are gone for a few hours too many I never question that there will be an issue. The only problem I have right now is one of our other dogs has started to use them when we are gone too long too. Well, at least it is easier to clean than a puddle and with easy clean up there is no smell.
customer_reviews.author: Jhow

customer_reviews.title: with mult rescue dogs, saves us while potty training them all at once
customer_reviews.text: These are so necessary for our rescue dogs - we pay a higher price but they are durable for chewers/paper rippers, for heavy dogs walking and running across them, etc. Appreciate the quality of the product and the larger quantities per package so we can continue to successfully house train our fostered rescue dogs.
customer_reviews.author: felicity

customer_reviews.title: IDEA: Underneath RV Kitty Litter Box
customer_reviews.text: GENIUS genius. It occurred to me to place one of these beneath the litter boxes in our RV for the cats. WOW! The first time some "Number One" went astray, landing on the puppy pad instead of on our genuine cherry wood floor (and instead of into the litter box)... well, they PAID for themselves. GREAT PRODUCT. Super absorbent. Can't travel without them NOW!
customer_reviews.author: FLowWOOLF NATURALS

customer_reviews.title: I use them in front of my older cat's little box
customer_reviews.text: She misses every now and then and when she did it was a nasty mess until I got these. I ordered my fist package 10/2018 and just now in 05/04 i have ordered another one. She doesn't do it often but when she does now it is a breeze to just fold it up and throw it away. Never leaks, never falls apart. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Omadna

customer_reviews.title: Try this test.
customer_reviews.text: When we first bought these, it was our first time. We thought, like some of the reviews, that the pads were leaking through. Then we tried to double, to see if it leaks through. I have to say, it did not. The whole pack was fine. So it seems, these are the way to go. Try it out yourself, because the leading brand is almost DOUBLE THE PRICE.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny H.

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Happy with them but they don't fit the iris holder. My puppy rather eat them but she's learning.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sanfilippo

customer_reviews.title: They do exactly what you need them to!
customer_reviews.text: These things can hold a lot of pee! More than my cat can, thankfully. They do exactly what they are intended to and don't leak like my cat does. The only problem I ever had was when the cat peed on the outer blue edge of the pad which is not intended to being absorbent and I didn't notice. That resulted in a rather unfortunate mess. But otherwise these things have saved me from a far worse mess every time!
customer_reviews.author: Ian M. Zapczynski

customer_reviews.title: A disappointing purchase
customer_reviews.text: No adhesive on back. Pee spills over the sides. Too little absorbency. Pad slides and folds constantly. I have an old small dog and have used other pads with far better results. Money back guarantee?
customer_reviews.author: Laura B.

customer_reviews.title: Best I have found
customer_reviews.text: I love these pads. I have small, older dogs who cannot manage the winter cold and this is a perfect solution. I have tried other brands, tried to save some money and repeatedly have been disappointed. Don’t mess with what works! I would love to purchase by the case as they are a staple for my dog.
customer_reviews.author: T. Lee Burger

customer_reviews.title: GREAT QUALITY AT A TERRIFIC PRICE
customer_reviews.text: These training pads are awesome. I have 2 small chihuahuas who use the pads exclusively, especially since I became disabled 3 years ago and can no longer physically walk them outside. I have purchased these pads for years, and they are a great quality at a terrific price. They are the perfect size for a small dog or puppy. I have tried them all, but these are THE BEST.
customer_reviews.author: Shelli

customer_reviews.title: They work well enough
customer_reviews.text: These work for me. I have a cat who has a litter box aversion. He goes right outside the box. So these are perfect to pu in front of the box. I have notified they have gotten much thinner since I started purchasing them. Also, they do nothing for odor control.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry Ann Mormello

customer_reviews.title: 140-lb Bloodhound proof
customer_reviews.text: These work great against the flood coming from my elderly Bloodhound. What was taking 2 bath towels or half a roll of paper towels is contained. He just seemed to know how to use them, too.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Only ones I use!
customer_reviews.text: These worked perfect for our inside dogs. Other than ordering the wrong size. I will definitely order them again but, in the correct size. perfect value!
customer_reviews.author: Emily Davis

customer_reviews.title: Double up!
customer_reviews.text: We have a 15 pound dog who is totally an inside dog, aside from his 3 times a day outdoor walks. We use these inside the house for him to relive himself. Nothing will ever hold all the moisture by itself and we do double these up when we lay them out on the floor, just to avoid unwanted leakage. Odors emanating from these really are not a problem at all. We tried all variety of training pads before finally finding these and have been using these for about 2 years now. We are very satisfied with these pads.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary Wilson

product_meta.title: All-Absorb Training Pads
product_meta.description: Size:Pack of 40| Style:Extra Large - 28" x 34"Every All-absorb training pad consists of 5 layers of materials. The first layer is made of non-woven cloth, which allows dog urine flow through to the absorbent core quickly. The second layer is made of paper tissue, added with dog attractant and baking soda. The third layer is a mix of super-absorbent polymer and fluff pulp, which forms the absorbent core that can absorb and turn dog urine to gel instantly. The absorbent core can hold 3 cups of liquid. The fourth layer is also made of paper tissue. The back layer is made of water-proof PE film, which prevents wetting your floor.
feature_bullets: The super-absorbent core can turn urine into gel instantly and hold more than 3 cups of liquid
Perfect for training or assisting aging large breed dogs
